_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Fill alarm at 80% with auto. Shutoff at 85%, min. class 1 Div. 1 electric w/in 5 ft. of all transfer (truck offloading) points w/Class 1 Div. 2 from 5-15 feet, Class 1 Div. 2 w/in 15 ft. of remainder
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Hydrocarbon detectors, flow monitoring, temperature, pressure & liquid level indicators
_prev_prog_3.Description: Butane Blending System consists of two (2) vessels plus lines.  Butane (liquefied and stored under pressure), is blended via direct injection to refined product (gasoline) pipelines with bulk truck offloading.  System operations are anticipated to occur primarily during the cold season.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Kinder Morgan CFPL Tampa Terminal - Tampa Terminal Butane Blending System was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) #58 (2014 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws/codes. It is the intent of the Tampa Terminal to incorporate the most recent construction and procedural guidance (NFPA # 58-2014 Edition) into this process. If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Tampa Fire Rescue as well as the Hillsborough County Emergency Management. Medical emergencies will require notification of the local Emergency Medical Services (Rural/Metro Ambulance) and Tampa General Hospital.



Kinder Morgan CFPL Tampa Terminal - Tampa Terminal is a bulk petroleum storage and distribution facility that includes butane blending operations. This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the butane blending system, including the associated piping and two butane storage vessels.



Kinder Morgan CFPL Tampa Terminal - Tampa Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119) along with its fourteen (14) compliance elements, and all applicable state and local laws and regulations. The butane blending system is designed, constructed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the manufacturer (Sunoco Partners Marketing & Terminals L.P.).



As this is a new system, this facility has never had an accident involving the butane process which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Kinder Morgan CFPL Tampa Terminal - Tampa Terminal butane blending system, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the Tampa Fire Rescue (Pri

mary Responder) and request their assistance. The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with fire department and the Hillsborough County Emergency Management. The Tampa Fire Rescue has participated in the initial RMP/PSM training session for this system.



Process safety controls include excess flow valves, low-melting point pneumatic valve feeds to pneumatic valves (fail closed), 85% fill shut-off (80% alarm and 90% ESD actuation) on the vessels, emergency shut-off devices on the system and video display terminal, line thermal/hydrostatic reliefs, and grounding interlock devices.



In an effort to improve and promote system safety, Kinder Morgan CFPL Tampa Terminal looks for, and seeks employee input, on process safety improvements. The Tampa Fire Rescue is contacted regarding participation in site emergency response drills. Additionally, Kinder Morgan CFPL Tampa Terminal will work cooperatively with the community to address any concerns.
